chain.description: Choose which network / blockchain to use.

chain.name: Chain
chain.description: Run this node on the given network.

testnet.name: Testnet
testnet.description: Run this node on the Bitcoin Test Network. Equivalent to -chain=test

regtest.name: Regtest
regtest.description: Run this node on its own independent test network. Equivalent to -chain=regtest

signet.name: Signet
signet.description: Use the signet chain. Equivalent to -chain=signet. Note that the network is defined by the -signetchallenge parameter

signetchallenge.name: Signet Challenge
signetchallenge.description: Blocks must satisfy the given script to be considered valid (only for signet networks)

signetseednode.name: Signet Seed Node
signetseednode.description: Specify a seed node for the signet network, in the hostname[:port] format, e.g. sig.net:1234 (may be used multiple times to specify multiple seed nodes)

vbparams.name: Version Bits Deployment Params
vbparams.description: Use given start/end times for specified version bits deployment. Regtest mode only, in format <deployment:start:end[:min_activation_height]>. Can be set multiple times.

app.description: Basic parameters regarding LND node operation.

datadir.name: Data Dir
datadir.description: The directory that lnd stores all wallet, chain, and channel related data

logdir.name: Log Dir
logdir.description: The directory that logs are stored in. The logs are auto-rotated by default. Rotated logs are compressed in place.

maxlogfiles.name: Max Log Files
maxlogfiles.description: Number of logfiles that the log rotation should keep. Setting it to 0 disables deletion of old log files.

maxlogfilesize.name: Max Log File Size
maxlogfilesize.description: Max log file size in MB before it is rotated.

acceptortimeout.name: Acceptor Timeout
acceptortimeout.description: Time after which an RPCAcceptor will time out and return false if it hasn't yet received a response.

tlscertpath.name: TLS Cert Path
tlscertpath.description: Path to TLS certificate for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlskeypath.name: TLS Private Key Path
tlskeypath.description: Path to TLS private key for lnd's RPC and REST services.

tlsextraip.name: Tls Extra IP
tlsextraip.description: Adds an extra ip to the generated certificate. Setting multiple tlsextraip= entries is allowed.

tlsextradomain.name: Tls Extra domain
tlsextradomain.description: Adds an extra domain to the generate certificate. Setting multiple tlsextradomain= entries is allowed.

tlsautorefresh.name: Tls auto refresh
tlsautorefresh.description: The duration from generating the self signed certificate to the certificate expiry date. Valid time units are {s, m, h}. The below value is about 14 months (14 * 30 * 24 = 10080)

tlscertduration.name: Publish Hash Sequence Message High Water Mark
tlscertduration.description: If set, then all certs will automatically be refreshed if they're close to expiring, or if any parameters related to extra IPs or domains in the cert change.

tlsdisableautofill.name: Tls disable auto fill
tlsdisableautofill.description: Do not include the interface IPs or the system hostname in TLS certificate, use first --tlsextradomain as Common Name instead, if set.

externalhosts.name: External Hosts
externalhosts.description: A list of domains for lnd to periodically resolve, and advertise the resolved. IPs for the backing node. This is useful for users that only have a dynamic IP, or want to expose the node at a domain.

letsencryptdir.name: Lets encrypt dir
letsencryptdir.description: Lets the directory to store Let's Encrypt certificates within

letsencryptlisten.name: Lets encrypt listen
letsencryptlisten.description: The IP:port on which lnd will listen for Let's Encrypt challenges.

letsencryptdomain.name: Lets encrypt domain
letsencryptdomain.description: Request a Let's Encrypt certificate for this domain. Note that the certificate is only requested and stored when the first rpc connection comes in.

no-macaroons.name: No macaroons
no-macaroons.description: Disable macaroon authentication. Macaroons are used as bearer credentials to authenticate all RPC access

sync-freelist.name: Sync Fee List
sync-freelist.description: Enable free list syncing for the default bbolt database. This will decrease start up time, but can result in performance degradation for very large databases, and also result in higher memory usage. If "free list corruption" is detected, then this flag may resolve things.

adminmacaroonpath.name: Admin Macaroon Path
adminmacaroonpath.description: Path to write the admin macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist

readonlymacaroonpath.name: Read only macaroon
readonlymacaroonpath.description: Path to write the read-only macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist.

invoicemacaroonpath.name: invoice macaroon path
invoicemacaroonpath.description: Path to write the invoice macaroon for lnd's RPC and REST services if it doesn't exist.

coin-selection-strategy.name: Coin Selection Strategy
coin-selection-strategy.description: The strategy to use for selecting coins for wallet transactions. Options are 'largest' and 'random'.

payments-expiration-grace-period.name: Payments expiration grace period
payments-expiration-grace-period.description: A period to wait before for closing channels with outgoing htlcs that have timed out and are a result of this nodes instead payment. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

listen.name: Listen
listen.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for p2p connections. One listen address per line.

nolisten.name: No Listen
nolisten.description: Disable listening for incoming p2p connections. This will override all listeners.

rpclisten.name: RPC Listen
rpclisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for gRPC connections. One listen address per line.

restlisten.name: REST Listen
restlisten.description: Specify the interfaces to listen on for REST connections. One listen address per line.

restcors.name: REST CORS
restcors.description: A series of domains to allow cross origin access from. This controls the CORs policy of the REST RPC proxy.

externalip.name: External Ip
externalip.description: Adding an external IP will advertise your node to the network. This signals that your node is available to accept incoming channels. If you don't wish to advertise your node, this value doesn't need to be set.

nat.name: NAT
nat.description: Instead of explicitly stating your external IP address, you can also enable UPnP or NAT-PMP support on the daemon.

no-rest-tls.name: No REST TLS
no-rest-tls.description: Disable TLS for the REST API.

addpeer.name: Add Peer
addpeer.description: Specify peer(s) to connect to first.

ws-ping-interval.name: WS Ping Interval
ws-ping-interval.description: The ping interval for REST based WebSocket connections, set to 0 to disable sending ping messages from the server side. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

ws-pong-wait.name: WS Pong Wait
ws-pong-wait.description: The time we wait for a pong response message on REST based WebSocket connections before the connection is closed as inactive. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

minbackoff.name: Min Backoff
minbackoff.description: Shortest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

maxbackoff.name: Max Backoff
maxbackoff.description: Longest backoff when reconnecting to persistent peers. Valid time units are {s, m, h}.

connectiontimeout.name: Connection Timeout
connectiontimeout.description: The timeout value for network connections in seconds, default to 120 seconds. Valid uints are {ms, s, m, h}.

debuglevel.name: Debug Level
debuglevel.description: Debug logging level. Valid levels are {trace, debug, info, warn, error, critical}

cpuprofile.name: CPU Profile
cpuprofile.description: Write CPU profile to the specified file.

profile.name: Profile
profile.description: Enable HTTP profiling on given port -- NOTE port must be between 1024 and 65536. The profile can be access at: http://localhost:<PORT>/debug/pprof/.

unsafe-replay.name: Unsafe Replay
unsafe-replay.description: Causes a link to replay the adds on its commitment txn after starting up, this enables testing of the sphinx replay logic.

maxpendingchannels.name: Max Pending Channels
maxpendingchannels.description: The maximum number of incoming pending channels permitted per peer.

backupfilepath.name: Backup file Path
backupfilepath.description: The target location of the channel backup file.

blockcachesize.name: Block Cache Size
blockcachesize.description: The maximum capacity of the block cache in bytes. Increasing this will result in more blocks being kept in memory but will increase performance when the same block is required multiple times.

feeurl.name: Fee Url
feeurl.description: Optional URL for external fee estimation. If no URL is specified, the method for fee estimation will depend on the chosen backend and network. Must be set for neutrino on mainnet.

nobootstrap.name: No Boot Strap
nobootstrap.description: If true, then automatic network bootstrapping will not be attempted. This means that your node won't attempt to automatically seek out peers on the network

noseedbackup.name: No Seed Backup
noseedbackup.description: If true, NO SEED WILL BE EXPOSED -- EVER, AND THE WALLET WILL BE ENCRYPTED USING THE DEFAULT PASSPHRASE. THIS FLAG IS ONLY FOR TESTING AND SHOULD NEVER BE USED ON MAINNET.

wallet-unlock-password-file.name: Wallet Unlock Password File
wallet-unlock-password-file.description:
The full path to a file (or pipe/device) that contains the password for 
;unlocking the wallet; if set, no unlocking through RPC is possible and lnd
; will exit if no wallet exists or the password is incorrect; if
; wallet-unlock-allow-create is also set then lnd will ignore this flag if no
; wallet exists and allow a wallet to be created through RPC.

wallet-unlock-allow-create.name: Wallet Unlock Allow Create
wallet-unlock-allow-create.description:
Don't fail with an error if wallet-unlock-password-file is set but no wallet
; exists yet. Not recommended for auto-provisioned or high-security systems
; because the wallet creation RPC is unauthenticated and an attacker could
; inject a seed while lnd is in that state.

reset-wallet-transactions.name: Reset Wallet Transactions
reset-wallet-transactions.description:
Removes all transaction history from the on-chain wallet on startup, forcing a
; full chain rescan starting at the wallet's birthday. Implements the same
; functionality as btcwallet's dropwtxmgr command. Should be set to false after
; successful execution to avoid rescanning on every restart of lnd.

minchansize.name: Minimum Channel Size
minchansize.description: The smallest channel size (in satoshis) that we should accept. Incoming channels smaller than this will be rejected, default value 20000.

maxchansize.name: Max Channel Size
maxchansize.description: The largest channel size (in satoshis) that we should accept. Incoming channels larger than this will be rejected. For non-Wumbo channels this limit remains 16777215 satoshis by default as specified in BOLT-0002.

coop-close-target-confs.name: Coopertive Close Target Confirmations
coop-close-target-confs.description:
The target number of blocks in which a cooperative close initiated by a remote
; peer should be confirmed. This target is used to estimate the starting fee
; rate that will be used during fee negotiation with the peer. This target is
; is also used for cooperative closes initiated locally if the --conf_target
; for the channel closure is not set.

channel-commit-interval.name: Channel Commit Interval
channel-commit-interval.description:
The maximum time that is allowed to pass between receiving a channel state
; update and signing the next commitment. Setting this to a longer duration
; allows for more efficient channel operations at the cost of latency.

pending-commit-interval.name: Pending Commit Interval
pending-commit-interval.description:
The maximum time that is allowed to pass while waiting for the remote party
; to revoke a locally initiated commitment state

channel-commit-batch-size.name: Channel Commit Batch Size
channel-commit-batch-size.description:
The maximum number of channel state updates that is accumulated before signing
; a new commitment.

keep-failed-payment-attempts.name: Keep Failed Payment Attempts
keep-failed-payment-attempts.description:
Keeps persistent record of all failed payment attempts for successfully
; settled payments.

default-remote-max-htlcs.name: Default Remote Max HTLCs
default-remote-max-htlcs.description:
The default max_htlc applied when opening or accepting channels. This value
; limits the number of concurrent HTLCs that the remote party can add to the
; commitment. The maximum possible value is 483.

chan-enable-timeout.name: Channel Enable Timeout
chan-enable-timeout.description:
The duration that a peer connection must be stable before attempting to send a
; channel update to re-enable or cancel a pending disables of the peer's channels
; on the network.

chan-disable-timeout.name: Channel Disable Timeout
chan-disable-timeout.description:
The duration that must elapse after first detecting that an already active
; channel is actually inactive and sending channel update disabling it to the 
; network. The pending disable can be canceled if the peer reconnects and becomes
; stable for chan-enable-timeout before the disable update is sent.

chan-status-sample-interval.name: Channel Status Sample Interval
chan-status-sample-interval.description: The polling interval between attempts to detect if an active channel has become; inactive due to its peer going offline.

height-hint-cache-query-disable.name: Height Hit Cache Query Disable
height-hint-cache-query-disable.description:
Disable queries from the height-hint cache to try to recover channels stuck in
; the pending close state. Disabling height hint queries may cause longer chain
; rescans, resulting in a performance hit. Unset this after channels are unstuck
; so you can get better performance again.

historicalsyncinterval.name: Historical Sync Interval
historicalsyncinterval.description:
The polling interval between historical graph sync attempts. Each historical
; graph sync attempt ensures we reconcile with the remote peer's graph from the
; genesis block.

ignore-historical-gossip-filters.name: Ignore Historical Gossip Filters
ignore-historical-gossip-filters.description:
If true, will not reply with historical data that matches the range specified
; by a remote peer's gossip_timestamp_filter. Doing so will result in lower
; memory and bandwidth requirements.

rejectpush.name: Reject Push
rejectpush.description:
If true, lnd will not accept channel opening requests with non-zero push
; amounts. This should prevent accidental pushes to merchant nodes.

rejecthtlc.name: Reject HTLCs
rejecthtlc.description: If true, lnd will not forward any HTLCs that are meant as onward payments. This; option will still allow lnd to send HTLCs and receive HTLCs but lnd won't be; used as a hop.

requireinterceptor.name: Require Interceptor
requireinterceptor.description: If true, all HTLCs will be held until they are handled by an interceptor

stagger-initial-reconnect.name: Stagger Initial Reconnect
stagger-initial-reconnect.description:
If true, will apply a randomized staggering between 0s and 30s when
; reconnecting to persistent peers on startup. The first 10 reconnections will be
; attempted instantly, regardless of the flag's value

max-cltv-expiry.name: Max CLTV Expiry
max-cltv-expiry.description:
The maximum number of blocks funds could be locked up for when forwarding
; payments. (default: 2016)

max-channel-fee-allocation.name: Max Channel Fee Allocation
max-channel-fee-allocation.description:
The maximum percentage of total funds that can be allocated to a channel's
; commitment fee. This only applies for the initiator of the channel. Valid
; values are within [0.1, 1]. (default: 0.5)

max-commit-fee-rate-anchors.name: Max Commit Fee Rate Anchors
max-commit-fee-rate-anchors.description:
The maximum fee rate in sat/vbyte that will be used for commitments of
; channels of the anchors type. Must be large enough to ensure transaction
; propagation

dust-threshold.name: Dust Threshold
dust-threshold.description:
A threshold defining the maximum amount of dust a given channel can have
; after which forwarding and sending dust HTLC's to and from the channel will
; fail. This amount is expressed in satoshis.

dry-run-migratio.name: Dry Run Migration
dry-run-migratio.description:
If true, lnd will abort committing a migration if it would otherwise have been
; successful. This leaves the database unmodified, and still compatible with the
; previously active version of lnd.

enable-upfront-shutdown.name: Enable Upfront Shutdown
enable-upfront-shutdown.description:
If true, option upfront shutdown script will be enabled. If peers that we open
; channels with support this feature, we will automatically set the script to
; which cooperative closes should be paid out to on channel open. This offers the
; partial protection of a channel peer disconnecting from us if cooperative
; close is attempted with a different script.

accept-keysend.name: Accept Keysend
accept-keysend.description:
If true, spontaneous payments through keysend will be accepted.
; This is a temporary solution until AMP is implemented which is expected to be soon.
; This option will then become deprecated in favor of AMP.

keysend-hold-time.name: Keysend Hold Time
keysend-hold-time.description:
If non-zero, keysend payments are accepted but not immediately settled. If the
; payment isn't settled manually after the specified time, it is canceled
; automatically. [experimental]

accept-amp.name: Accept AMP
accept-amp.description:
If true, spontaneous payments through AMP will be accepted. Payments to AMP
; invoices will be accepted regardless of this setting.

gc-canceled-invoices-on-startup=true.name: Garbage Collect Invoice on Startup
gc-canceled-invoices-on-startup=true.description: If true, we'll attempt to garbage collect canceled invoices upon start.

gc-canceled-invoices-on-the-fly.name: Garbage Collect
gc-canceled-invoices-on-the-fly.description: If true, we'll delete newly canceled invoices on the fly.

allow-circular-route.name: Allow Ciruclar Route
allow-circular-route.description: If true, our node will allow htlc forwards that arrive and depart on the same channel.

trickledelay.name: Trick Delay
trickledelay.description: Time in milliseconds between each release of announcements to the network

numgraphsyncpeers.name: Number Graph Sync Peers
numgraphsyncpeers.description:
The number of peers that we should receive new graph updates from. This option
; can be tuned to save bandwidth for light clients or routing nodes.

prometheus.enable.name: Prometheus Enable
prometheus.enable.description:
If true, lnd will start the Prometheus exporter. Prometheus flags are 
; behind a build/compile flag and are not available by default. lnd must be built 
; with the monitoring tag; `make && make install tags=monitoring` to activate them.

prometheus.listen.name: Prometheus Listen
prometheus.listen.description: Specify the interface to listen on for Prometheus connections.

prometheus.perfhistograms.name: Prometheus Perfhistograms
prometheus.perfhistograms.description:
If true, then we'll export additional information that allows users to plot
; the processing latency, and total time spent across each RPC calls+service.
; This generates additional memory load for the Prometheus server, and will end
; up using more disk space over time.

alias.name: Alias
alias.description: The alias your node will use, which can be up to 32 UTF-8 characters in length.

color.name: Color
color.description:
The color of the node in hex format, used to customize node appearance in
; intelligence services.

bitcoin.active.name: Bitcoin Active
bitcoin.active.description: If the Bitcoin chain should be active. Atm, only a single chain can be active.

bitcoin.chaindir.name: Bitcoin Chaindir
bitcoin.chaindir.description: The directory to store the chain's data within.

bitcoin.signetchallenge.name: Bitcoin Signetchallenge
bitcoin.signetchallenge.description: Connect to a custom signet network defined by this challenge instead of using the global default signet test network -- Can be specified multiple times

bitcoin.signetseednode.name: Bitcoin Signet Seed Node
bitcoin.signetseednode.description: Specify a seed node for the signet network instead of using the global default signet network seed nodes

bitcoin.node.name: Bitcoin Node
bitcoin.node.description: Specify the chain back-end. NOTE: Please note that switching between a full back-end (btcd/bitcoind) and a light back-end (neutrino) is not supported.

bitcoin.defaultchanconfs.name: Bitcoin Default channel Confirmations
bitcoin.defaultchanconfs.description: The default number of confirmations a channel must have before it's considered open. We'll require any incoming channel requests to wait this many confirmations before we consider the channel active.

bitcoin.defaultremotedelay.name: Bitcoin Defaultremotedelay
bitcoin.defaultremotedelay.description: The default number of blocks we will require our channel counterparty to wait; before accessing its funds in case of unilateral close. If this is not set, we; will scale the value according to the channel size.

bitcoin.maxlocaldelay.name: Bitcoin Maxlocaldelay
bitcoin.maxlocaldelay.description: The maximum number of blocks we will limit the wait that our own funds are encumbered by in the case when our node unilaterally closes. If a remote peer proposes a channel with a delay above this amount, lnd will reject the channel.

bitcoin.minhtlc.name: Bitcoin Min HTLC
bitcoin.minhtlc.description: The smallest HTLC we are willing to accept on our channels, in millisatoshi.

bitcoin.minhtlcout.name: Bitcoin Min HTLCL Out
bitcoin.minhtlcout.description: The smallest HTLC we are willing to send out on our channels, in millisatoshi.

bitcoin.basefee.name: Bitcoin Base Fee
bitcoin.basefee.description: The base fee in millisatoshi we will charge for forwarding payments on our channels.

bitcoin.feerate.name: Bitcoin Feerate
bitcoin.feerate.description: The fee rate used when forwarding payments on our channels. The total fee charged is basefee + (amount * feerate / 1000000), where amount is the forwarded amount.

bitcoin.timelockdelta.name: Bitcoin Timelock Delta
bitcoin.timelockdelta.description: The CLTV delta we will subtract from a forwarded HTLC's timelock value.

bitcoin.dnsseed.name: Bitcoin DNS Seed
bitcoin.dnsseed.description: The seed DNS server(s) to use for initial peer discovery. Must be specified as a '<primary_dns>[,<soa_primary_dns>]' tuple where the SOA address is needed for DNS resolution through Tor but is optional for clearnet users. Multiple tuples can be specified, will overwrite the default seed servers. The default seed servers are
